sense.name: self_contained portion of a larger document
sense.examples: John handed me the real estate section of the Sunday newspaper. The algorithm is explained in the final section of the chapter. There is a section on frozen desserts in this cookbook.

sense.name: an extremely thin slice of tissue or substance
sense.examples: The pathologist examined sections of lung tumor under a microscope. The lab assistant prepared sections of plant cellulose for the biologist.

sense.name: an identifiable division of a larger whole
sense.examples: Residents pay higher property taxes in the historical sections of the city. You'll find perfumes near the cosmetics section of the store. These sections of the country have experienced the greatest drop in housing prices.

sense.name: one of several uniform components of an artifact that can be assembled to other components
sense.examples: The bookcases were shipped in sections and require assembly. Several sections of track along the railway line between Chicago and Detroit needed repair. Mary cut the cake into sections before serving it.

sense.name: squadron or unit with a mission
sense.examples: He is a police captain who works in a section on vice. The commandos were a special section within Delta Force.

sense.name: a measurement unit equal to 1 square mile
sense.examples: How much does it cost to irrigate a section of farmland in this region? His soybean crop consists of 5 sections.

sense.name: 2D geometric region obtained by passing a plane through a geometric solid
sense.examples: The plane cuts through the cone to form a circular section. At an oblique angle, a plane cutting through a cone forms an oval section.

sense.name: student study group, subset of a larger course
sense.examples: There are five sections to the freshman history class that meet on Tuesdays or Thursdays. A professor gave the lectures for the chemistry course, but the sections were taught by his TAs.

sense.name: portion of orchestra with players of one class of instruments
sense.examples: There is an opening in the woodwind section of the ballet orchestra. The conductor did not arrange the players according to section.

sense.name: a segment of citrus fruit
sense.examples: Sally offered the child a section of tangerine. The cake was garnished with orange sections and mint leaves.

sense.name: the surgical cutting of flesh, tissue
sense.examples: The doctor performed a C-section on the woman after 12 hours of labor. The surgeon performed the section and had the intern suture it afterwards.

sense.name: a typographical symbol that serves as a reference mark
sense.examples: This special character is a section indicator in this text.
